website_summaries.verdict: The Netgear WNDR4500 N900 Wireless Dual Band Gigabit Router makes a very good investment for those who want to get the most out of a wireless network, especially when they have clients that support the 5GHz band.
pros: The Netgear WNDR4500 N900 Wireless Dual Band Gigabit Router supports the new 450Mbps standard on both bands, and offers great range and excellent data rates on the 5GHz band
The router comes with the robust and easy-to-use Netgear Genie management software and boasts lots of features
cons: The Netgear WNDR4500's 24.GHz wireless performance is subpar, and its USB storage performance could also use some improvement

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one of these. The first lasted over 7 years and finally gave up. I wanted to get one asap so went to Target and bought the top of the line NetGear router (more than $100 more expensive). This was a disaster. Took over 5 hours with tech support (who were great) to finally get it working. After 2 days it stopped working again. It is simply too complicated. Stick with this one as it is very reliable, relatively easy to set up. The Tech support staff recommended this although I would have bought it anyway. The company continues to modernize this model, now on version 3 and offers very strong support. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Aussie

customer_reviews.title: Handles it all
customer_reviews.text: After 5 years, this router is going strong. Great speeds through the 5 ghz channel, even with tons of devices connected (up to 4 tablets, 2 phones, 2 tvs, 2 rokus, 2 amazon fire tvs, 2 blu ray players, 5 security cameras, remote camera base with 4 more cameras, Nest thermostat, 7 Nest smoke detectors, 3 Alexa Echos, a smart plug, a smart space heater, 2 Nintendo 3ds, Nintendo Wii, holy cow I never listed it all out before...) all while acting as a media server with over 200 movies on a USB stick plugged into it.
customer_reviews.author: John W

customer_reviews.title: crapped out after 3. 5 years. Come on ...
customer_reviews.text: crapped out after 3.5 years. Come on Netgear, this is a freaking 120$ router! There are no mechanical parts, all solid state electronics. What kind of junk quality do you have to reach to make it fail within such a short time? A bicycle left out in the rain wouldn't fail that fast. And that measly 1 year warranty, so that says basically you are buying a router with expected 1 year of lifetime
customer_reviews.author: Mr YANG

customer_reviews.title: Great interface but not reliable if using for business.
customer_reviews.text: I gave it a 3 because after about 3 months it would drop my internet connection every two weeks. I had to reset it and start over again to get it working. I work from home and could not have my network down while I was trying to work. Ended up buying a professional router to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Dad69

customer_reviews.title: It works but gives me hell
customer_reviews.text: It is not nearly as fast as promised, not even in the ballpark, and it behaves differently from PC to PC and never great, the transfer rates, both wireless and wired, fluctuates, sometimes wildly and forget about transferring substantial data to the USB storage connected to it via WiFi, just forget about it. The support really tried though but it is finite as after a while you have to pay for the service. An update helped allot as it automatically connected to the primary router, that was awesome, but the transfer rates were still weak, and the WiFi to router USB devices is still horrendous to unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Aldenone

customer_reviews.title: Don't do it!  You'll thank me later!
customer_reviews.text: Loved it, then hated it. Netgear routers have no ability to handle DoS Attack: ACK Scan. Worked awesome for 18 months, then it fell apart. Constant internet up/down, router restarts, and headaches. DO NOT BUY THIS! In fact, avoid Netgear all together as they are aware of the problem but chose to do nothing about it. I've just ordered my replacement router, this Netgear clunker is now an expensive paperweight.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Buchert

customer_reviews.title: Like the previous two
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Netgear router. Like the previous two, it has failed after less than two years of use. So it will be my last Netgear product. Like its predecessors, I works just great right up until the moment that it inexplicably stops working. Easy to set up and operate, fast and attractive (if that matters), it's an excellent value—except of course that it will not last more than two years. I'm moving on to another brand. Wish I didn't have to, but Netgear tech support and customer service inform me that there's nothing they can do for me. It seems they're not even interested in keeping me as a customer. Their wish is hereby granted.
customer_reviews.author: Random Reader

customer_reviews.title: Printer sharing - failed
customer_reviews.text: Wireless speed and coverage leaves nothing to be desired with this router. Initial setup was easy. Everything works much better than my previous router. Unfortunately I bought N900 mainly to connect Canon Pixma Pro 9500 II to my windows and mac computers. It simply does not work properly no matter what I tried. It either prints part of the photograph and stops in the middle or cannot connect to printer at all. I spent a couple days trying to figure out this problem without success. And don't forget ridiculous printer utility for mac that you need to start in order to connect to printer. Tried the same thing with airport express and everything worked out flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Oleg Shpak

customer_reviews.title: Firmware corrupted, support should be called lack of support
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box does not work, firmware corrupted. Need to attempt somewhat complicated upload of firmware update. Tried dealing with customer support, who said would call me back, lol needless to say that has not happened yet. I have another netgear router that I was happy with and was upgrading to extend my range. Really disappointed. Have to say the netgear has lost a customer for life even if I get this to work, and I will not recommend their products to anyone I know. I know all electronics can come with glitches, but coupled with their atrocious customer support with an apparently widely known problem has sealed the deal with me.
customer_reviews.author: David M.

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable product.. Purchase at your own risk
customer_reviews.text: In the third month I started getting an yellow power light, and I contacted Net gear as I have 3 months of free Technical support( Just 3 months are you kidding me??). Now I spent an hour on the call then they decided to replace the product, now I got it and the second one works fine.. this time it worked for 8 months and I started seeing the same issue again. Now Net gear does not provide any support and it is a piece of crap hardware. And I payed 150$ for all this to Net gear and I am thinking is this worth it? Do I need to give these guys a third chance??
customer_reviews.author: TitanKun

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 8 months
customer_reviews.text: The router worked great while it worked, but unfortunately, it crapped out today after only 8 months. As Netgear only offers a 90 day warranty, there is little we can do. When I bought this router, I thought I would get what I paid for -- I figured that it would be worthwhile to buy a relatively expensive router because it's something that I use frequently, needs to work consistently, and that would last for years. As it turns out, it was a complete waste of money - an 8 month lifespan for a product that costs $130 is ridiculous. Don't bother spending the money on a Netgear router -- I won't make that mistake again.
customer_reviews.author: JanineK22

customer_reviews.title: It lasted 2 months.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Netgear WNDR4500 router on March 6, 2013 and it worked great at first. Then it stopped accessing the internet. I tried everything I could think of including reboots, power on/off, etc, but no luck. I tied my computer directly to the DSL modem and my connection to the internet worked. I finally substituted my old Netgear WNR3500L router and had my home network back up and running minus the extended coverage. I looked at all the reviews and it looked like the Asus RT-N66N had the same or betters specs and no bad comments about failure so I ordered it. I could not return the WNDR4500 since the Amazon return window expired April 8.
customer_reviews.author: RexS

customer_reviews.title: Keeps Bricking Each Time Power Cuts Out
customer_reviews.text: When it works, it works really well, with nice WiFi speeds and reliable connection. But it has a serious flaw, where if the power is cut abruptly, such as in a power outage, it tends to brick itself. Now, you can recover it, but you have to connect it to your PC directly, and change IP settings and TFTP the firmware directly to the router. While fixable it is an unnecessary pain that you shouldn't have to go through. It's certainly not something that a total PC illiterate would be able to handle on their own. It's a serious flaw in an otherwise solid router and I couldn't recommend this to people as a result.
customer_reviews.author: N.Hugo

customer_reviews.title: there are newer and better netgear routers out there for about the same price ...
customer_reviews.text: Lasted 5yrs before the power cord melted where it connects to back of the router. Don't know if this is a power cord issue or a router issue (I'm thinking power cord issue). Being 5ys old, there are newer and better netgear routers out there for about the same price this one is selling for. I was using the wndr4500 and a R6300v2 in a bridge mode to extend my coverage. I will replace the wndr4500 with another R6300v2.
customer_reviews.author: NL

customer_reviews.title: Much better than my last Linksys
customer_reviews.text: I have always purchased Linksys product since they are a product of Cisco systems. I know that Cisco does a lot of commecial work and provides products that allow cell phone services and other high tech devices and thought this must be the way to go. My last Linksys router started giving me trouble by dropping my internet connection on a regular basis. This may not be a fair comparison as my last router was in the $50 range while this one is $150 but I couldn't be happier with the improved reliability of this Netgear Router. Not sure if my experience is typical but I am now a Netgear fan.
customer_reviews.author: Bentley Robinette

customer_reviews.title: Avoid It Like the Plague!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned it now for over a year, wait that's not correct because the one I originally owned bricked itself during a recommended software upgrade. NETGEAR's Genie program installed the update which resulted in the router becoming bricked so NETGEAR sent me a refurbished router as a replacement. I buy a new one but because of their faulty tech I get refurbished, which eventually went bad. Now add to this the fact that if you go to NETGEAR's website it states "End of Life (Service Unavailable)" for this router. Don't buy a product that the manufacturer no longer supports and when they did it was a mess.
customer_reviews.author: TEN90X

customer_reviews.title: Does what i need...
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why people get the faster router, it doesnt improve internet speeds, it only improves on home network with streaming from PC to television, thats it. With that said, this supports to the devices i have, mainly the 5ghz function. Also using usb for my external hard drive to stream videos, pictures, whatever. Bought the same one for my parents too. The wireless range is pretty strong, from the external part of the house. Honestly say its supports a 2500sq ft home area.
customer_reviews.author: P J L U

customer_reviews.title: Almost 4 stars
customer_reviews.text: However, it did not get 4 stars because I have had several issues with it over the past year that involved me having to wipe the firmware and install it again using a TFTP program. Effectively if powered down, sometimes it will just not come back up. There was also one firmware upgrade that made it start sending out Wake On LAN magic packets every 5 minutes so all my computer kept turning on until I downgraded the firmware. Aside from this it works very well and has quite a few nice features. However, I think my next router will be an ASUS.
customer_reviews.author: S. Barrett

customer_reviews.title: Easiest Router I have Ever Installed
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this router a week but so far I am a happy camper. No dropped signals and no need to reset. I am not a computer geek, just a regular user. The installation was incredibly easy following the 5 simple steps in the one page installation guide. It was up and running in ten minutes. Previously the wireless signal in my wife's studio which is in a separate building outside the house was about 1 bar out of five. It now is 3-5 bars. And the wireless signal inside the house is robust, even through the walls. I had a configuration question which I submitted via e-mail and got an answer in under a day.
customer_reviews.author: gwpriester

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 14 months then needed DAILY power cycle
customer_reviews.text: I was going crazy and thought that there was something wrong with my internet because I had certain things plugged directly into the router & other things wirelessly. So naturally, I figured it wasn't a router problem. What would happen was every 24 hours, the internet would simply go out even though everything looked normal on both the modem & router. You would have to power cycle both the modem & router to get back online DAILY. I even brought out a tech from my ISP to no avail. I replaced the router & sure enough conveniently after the 1 year warranty was up, the thing breaks. TERRIBLE customer service & support. Won't be buying Netgear again!
customer_reviews.author: FightonSC

customer_reviews.title: Great Range and Throughput
customer_reviews.text: Finally, I have a wireless router that gives me a good signal everywhere in the house. I live in a neighborhood where I can see the networks of many neighbors, some of which are quite strong, so their is plenty of interference and sharing the airspace. I used another brand of router for many years, but I just could not get a good signal from my router to the far corners of my house. Putting in the Netgear N900 router solved that problem for me. My wireless video streaming is now reliable for the first time ever! When the time comes for a router upgrade, I will be looking at the routers from Netgear.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hanna

customer_reviews.title: Work great in the beginning and get worst and ultimate stop working.
customer_reviews.text: I am having this product for about two years. I works great for the 1st year and then I observe the my smart TV having buffering problem (without adding additional wireless devices) that we didn't have before and gradually the router just stop working and it has to be off power for a day and then for no reason it is working again overnight. Now, it happens again after power outrage. I might just need to get a non-Netgear router just to try its durability. I brought this for $154, not exactly a cheap router that time. What a disappointment I might to buy a new router again.
customer_reviews.author: P. Wong

customer_reviews.title: WNDR4500
customer_reviews.text: Constantly loses connection, back and fourth since day one. I think I might just go back to Belkin in a few months if this thing doesn't start acting right. UPDATE: There was a recent software update pushed to this router by Netgear (Firmware Version V1.0.1.38_1.0.64), along with the update I also (on my Windows 7 computer) disabled "Toreado Tunneling" and it seems to have fixed the internet connection issue for good. So along with updating the firmware, also google how disable Toreado Tunneling, on your computer and it should fix the internet from dropping. Updating from 1 star to 3.5
customer_reviews.author: Bran

customer_reviews.title: This is the only router to buy!!
customer_reviews.text: I disconnected my old Belkin and within 15 minutes was steaming along with my new Netgear WNDR4500 router. This goodie reaches all around my house, works flawlessly with my now networked Canon Multifunction printer and wireless BluRay player. I really cannot say enough about how pleased I am to have finally bought a piece of equipment that totally delivers. OK, so at $177.00 is sure is not the cheapest router around. But it seems to be worth every penny! The signal strength is phenomenal, through walls, past boiler rooms, up the stairs . . . and fast! Thank you Netgear for restoring my faith in the magic of wireless.
customer_reviews.author: Adirondack "Bob"

customer_reviews.title: Solid router
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an old no-name $25 wireless router with this one. I was not a fan of Netgear (based on some old grudges from when I used to use them). After setting this product up, I'm very happy with it. Very solid, reliable and great signals. You can setup different bands for WiFi, a separate "guest" network so that people coming over don't get on the same network as your computers. The integrated web-filtering works great for eliminating phishing and porn sites (if you set it up). It runs through OpenDNS and is free. Overall, very happy and well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: M. Sharp

customer_reviews.title: Works like a champ!
customer_reviews.text: The first router I received was faulty and Amazon replaced it immediately with zero fuss. I found this device incredibly easy to set up. I was careful to ensure everything was powered down first before hooking this up as other folks experienced difficulties when they failed to do that. This router has a powerful signal. I located the router in the top floor of a 4-level house and the signal is still at full strength in the basement. Making changes to settings is a breeze with the NETGEAR Genie. It took me about 15 minutes to set up and get all our devices connected to the new router. I'm very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Make it Easy

customer_reviews.title: Daily WAN drops.  Unreliable.
customer_reviews.text: When it was working it was excellent. However, at least daily, and sometimes twice daily, it would drop the WAN connection to the cable modem. It was easy to fix, but required daily intervention. It replaced my old Netgear WNDR3400, which almost never had a WAN drop. I checked the forums, and found this to be a common problem with the WNDR4500 - and I didn't want to waste time fixing something that should just work. So I returned through Amazon, and replaced with an ASUS RT-N56U, which after a week is flawless - not a single WAN drop. I'd say stay away from the WNDR4500 until they release firmware to correct this common problem.
customer_reviews.author: Kevinsky

customer_reviews.title: Netgear N900
customer_reviews.text: Works great so far! Installation was simple and quick. It offered an online Firmware upgrade right away that also worked without a hitch. Wifi performance is much better than my old Netgear equipment. We get 5 bars from a laptop one room away on the 2.4GHz band and 4 bars on the 5GHz band. (Laptop is about 1.5 year old entry level HP). Speedtest was about the same on both bands. With a Nook at the very far end of the house we get 2 bars now (previously 0). I did not use the USB ports for disk/printer yet. It also offers an online parental control feature that I have not explored yet.
customer_reviews.author: H. Frick

customer_reviews.title: very good router
customer_reviews.text: we really love this router. we live in a 2,000 square foot home and find this router reaches all areas. even in the way back of the house. our other router couldn't even reach that far. it's also great to have the 2 channels. my husband's xbox is on his own channel so speed doesn't get interrupted if I'm on the computer. note, we only have up to 100 mbps and not some super high speed internet.
customer_reviews.author: Randibeth

customer_reviews.title: Works but distance may be less than desirable.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and operate, very usefull self fix tools and aplications makes this very user friendly. This is not complicated at all. I have had no problems or issues with mine other than it does not reach out as far as I had hoped. I am trying to get signal in an out building about 150 feet from my home. At that range I have a very low signal and can usually only get 1 bar of strength. So I am adding a wifi extender/repeater to help boost the signal. As far as in my 3,000 cupbic foot home, 2,200sqf, the signal is at full strength in every room.
customer_reviews.author: jon smith

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Service - Died before 1 year
customer_reviews.text: Was very excited to upgrade from my Apple Airport Express. My company CIO said this would be the answer. He was wrong. Speeds were always 1/3 of what they should have been (capped at 27mbs) , suffered more and more drops in service as it aged. I power cycled it last night, and she never connected to the internet again. Hooked up a new Dlink today - works perfect, speeds are instantly as they should be. Maybe I got a lemon, but this certainly left me with a sour taste for Netgear. Also - my company's CIO is now the ex-CIO.
customer_reviews.author: asspantz

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed ~  Didn't even last a year
customer_reviews.text: This router didn't even last a year. Over the last year 10 months we have had to hardwire every single computer in the house and the top spot won't even work anymore and now I am looking to replace it. Rather disgusted actually.
customer_reviews.author: Lisasuniquegiftsnmore

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Brilliant
customer_reviews.text: I have tried about ten different routers in my two-story house. This is the ONLY one that worked all over the house and works with my U-Verse modem flawlessly. I'm using about 20 wired devices (with an additional switch) and several wireless including: * Two ipad 2s * 1 iPhone * 1 Android phone * 1 Apple macbook air * 1 Lenovo Thinkpad T420 All devices connect just fine and signal is VERY strong and fast all through the house and in the back yard. Very happy with this purchase even though the price is high. I guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: DIY Tool Reviews

customer_reviews.title: When it works it's great!
customer_reviews.text: Had this router since may 6. Setup was easy and quick. The 5G speed and distance was great. THEN, after less than a day, I started having DNS not resolved errors and losing the internet connection. Have been working with the Netgear Tech folks BUT so far none of the changes they suggested have fixed the problem. I did a internet search for this problem and people have been experiencing this for over a year now. Some people have had good luck fixing this but some have not. I'm going to send this back and get the Linksys EA4500!
customer_reviews.author: Richard W.

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Router
customer_reviews.text: When I went wireless I had to purchase a router that was compatible with the Cox system I have in San Diego. This one did it with bells. My computer guru who installed it was very impressed with its power and it has performed flawlessly since installation. It is able to handle both computers as well as the solar panel power transmissions that tell Vivint that all is well with their solar power cells. I relied on Amazon's write up in purchasing this router because I'm about useless on computer related products. As usual Amazon hit ti out of the park!
customer_reviews.author: Michael C. Miller

customer_reviews.title: A solid router
customer_reviews.text: The automatic setup worked as advertised, after downloading the interface program from the NETGEAR website. However, I required access to the more "advanced" setup (e.g., setting dhcp parameters, changing the router ip, etc.). Since the router does not ship with any information beyond basic setup, I had to do some exploration to find the access. However, once I did, I was pleased to find I had more control than other routers I had used. The reach of the signal in the house is good, and is superior to the main router I use to connect to the internet.
customer_reviews.author: DAG

customer_reviews.title: good device, but DO NOT reset the device by using the power button
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these within the last year. One as the primary hub for the house and one as an extension. the house is hardwired so the extension just allows greater range of wireless. Both work great, However, DO NOT hard boot the device by pressing the button, you will be on the phone with support for an hour while they have to reinstall the firmware. this has happened three times. Once by power outage (before I had it on a UPS), the other times I reset it due to some speed issues. If I have any reason, real or perceived, I reboot the device by going into the admin menus. this will not cause a firm ware issue.
customer_reviews.author: biggscpa

customer_reviews.title: Flawless Router
customer_reviews.text: This is, by far, the Netgear N900 dual band gigabit is best router I have ever tested. It's incredibly fast, easy to set up, has two USB ports for external backup drive, printer, etc., has 4-5 ethernet ports for wired connections, but most of all has both 2.4 and 5.0 bands. Easily accommodates medium size house with strong WiFi signal inside and outside. I currently have 2 laptops, backup drive, printer, three internet TVs and several other handheld devices (phones, pads, pods) connected at the same time with no apparent loss of signal strength. Best router I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Avoid
customer_reviews.text: I'm sorry, but this router has many problems. I'm a tech and I bought one of these April 2013. Within 5 months, the unit gradually died. Paid $30 to overnight a replacement when I finally got an RMA. This replacement lasted around 2 months when both the b/g/n and A band wireless stopped connecting. Ethernet and the rf transmitters worked. I again paid $30 to overnight another replacement after getting the RMA a bit quicker. Shortly after installing this unit, I noticed a problem. Ethernet works and wireless band A works, but b/g/n has a connecting speed less then 0.5 Mbps. Requesting another RMA, them to pay for overnight delivery and a one year warranty extension.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Kekeis

customer_reviews.title: Great Wireless Router
customer_reviews.text: I purchased and installed this router shortly after it was available and it has worked extremely well. It was very easy to setup and provides excellent coverage throughout our 2 story home. We have multiple laptops that access it, several wireless printers, and we stream movies to several tv's using Roku devices and BD players with internet connections. It is nice to say it just sits there and works. when the power does go, it resets itself without any assistance once power is restored. Additionally, it has a very nice form factor and takes up very little shelf space.
customer_reviews.author: CHTX

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a previous version of this router (WNR834 "draft" version) that I bought 5 or 6 years ago. Was having too many issues connecting with my new Moto Razr. Based on reviews here and cnet and the fact that I am familiar with netgear interface, I bought this. No more drop connections and slightly better range. I can now connect while I am in my yard. Only has it up for 2 or 3 weeks. No issues. I have 4 LAN connections that include printer, directv and 2 desktops. In addition to this I have 4 or 5 wireless devises connected.
customer_reviews.author: Attention To Detail

customer_reviews.title: Great until it fails... then not so much.
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my third WNDR4500. I probably should have accepted defeat sooner, but I really wanted to have faith in Netgear and the speed of this unit is a strong draw. Unfortunately each unit has died after 3 to 4 months use. The first two were replaced by Netgear (at my cost for shipping of course) and the third has been less than efficient in making contact with tech support or customer service. My current plan of attack is to order another unit to get back up and running while still trying to have the latest broken unit replaced.
customer_reviews.author: BravePhoto

customer_reviews.title: Keep up the good work, NetGear!
customer_reviews.text: I've been a NetGear fan for several generations of routers. Needless to say, I love NetGear, from port forwarding to dynamic DNS to remote management. With this router, I finally discovered the awesomeness of ReadyShare, which apparently was also present in my prior devices. If you have this or any other NetGear router and are not using ReadyShare to set up a home NAS (Network Attached Storage), you are missing out. It is also DLNA compatible, so you will be able to access NAS video, music, and pictures from your smart TV or Blu-ray player. Other features work just as well as I have come to expect from NetGear. Good job and keep it up.
customer_reviews.author: Victor

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace an "antique" Netgear router. Set it up and only had one minor glitch when my laptop tried to connect through it (but the router was not the issue, it was my satellite modem which always has issues. I setup this unit in my office (attached to the house) and am able to get a usable signal in my church which is about 100 yards away. The split signals help with the speed as I was able to setup my cell phones to use the 5G and leave the 2.4 just for our computers.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Corrupt Firmware
customer_reviews.text: It is sad when you buy a highly rated router and it comes with corrupt firmware. I reloaded it and it failed again. Hopefully number two is better. Unit is hooked up to a battery backup too. If it becomes corrupt just ship it back for a return, no use trying to "fix it" I will say when it did work the range was simply amazing compared to an old wrt45g I had been using. I get a clear signal down the street at least 10 or so houses away. Wow! It is located near my office window. Worked well with several laptops and iphones. even my xbox was happy!
customer_reviews.author: CMAC

customer_reviews.title: WNDR4500 will not even power up.
customer_reviews.text: The lights would not come on after attaching the power cord. Tried a compatible power source, which also did not work. After several irritating conversations with heavily-accented support workers from somewhere in India, whom I could scarcely understand, it became apparent that there was no recourse but to send it back to Netgear. There were 3 options for returning the unit, all of which require the consumer to pay for shipping. I'm guessing that this is will probably be a good router, once I get a healthy one, but I'm unhappy that the already premium price will be added to, because Netgear has made it my responsibility to get a unit that actually functions properly.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Pearson

customer_reviews.title: Almost what I expected
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews I purchased this router rather than one of the top five routers on cnet.com. Not only was it cheaper than the cnet routers, but it appeared to me (not a big tech person) to have the same or similar features. Having a two story home, I was hoping that I could place this router on the ground floor and get better coverage upstairs than what I had with my older router. Unfortunately, that was not the case. I get the same wifi reception as I did with my five year old router. Despite that, the ability to attach a USB hard drive and the additional security was worth the purchase price for me.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Very fast and stable
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the fastest and most reliable router I've used to date. Setup was a snap, Hardwired and Wi-fi 5G are smoking fast, Customizing options are modern and easy to use. I'm a PC enthusiast, everything has to be fast, especially my network. Streaming Blu-ray content across my house or short data backup times are a must. Previous models or other manufacturers could not perform this task without lag issues, no problems at all with my N900. Highly recommended,Great job Netgear.
customer_reviews.author: ukswrath

customer_reviews.title: So far go good!
customer_reviews.text: I did a bit of research before making the buying descision and so far i couldn't be more pleased. Over all it was pretty easy to set up. Granted I have set up a number of wireless routers over the years but by no means am I an IT / Network guy. I am just a normal guy wanting a home network. If you follow to the directions, set up is pretty easy. i was amble to have it up and running in about 15 minutes including a router software update. We are using the parent filter too and that could not have been easier. Overall, very happy.
customer_reviews.author: A. Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable and has hardware problems.
customer_reviews.text: This router has problems. It is cheaply made and Netgear will not stand behind it. Mine started dropping the internet connection within a few months of purchase. This happened many times and resulted in two support cases being opened at Netgear. Finally, just 9 months after I purchased it the LED started flashing indicating it had a hardware problem. No kidding. I can't recommend this router or Netgear. Buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Master

customer_reviews.title: Just adding my voice
customer_reviews.text: The Netgear N900 (WNDR4500) wireless router is reliable and FAST! I have a lot of experience with Internet providers and wireless routers so I know where the lost packets and slowdowns occur. The Netgear N900 installed in seconds, and it has been rock-solid since. My two wireless printers operate flawlessly on the WIFI net I installed. I bought the Netgear A6200 WIFI USB adapter from Amazon.com to connect my desktop and the Netgear N900 found it, connected immediately, and offers fast Internet speeds. I really don't think you'll regret buying the N900. It's a class act.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M. Shaw

customer_reviews.title: No issues and really gave better signal strength
customer_reviews.text: I have a 6500 square foot house with great distances from one wing to the other. It use to take 3 routers to do the job, but with the addition of this router in the West Wing, I was able to eliminate the centrally located router because this one covers the center of the house well. This is the first router that could do that. Speed is no issue but neither is my Linksys in the East Wing. Installation was a breeze. Reliability for the past month is 100%. I found this a perfect purchase for me.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Terrible customer support from Net Gear
customer_reviews.text: Had the unit for 8 months and worked fine then the internet port went dead. Forget about trying to get any service work or product support. The are not going to give you a return authorization number without a credit card number. Check out the warranty info before you buy. If you have an issue outside the return policy of Amazon your done. Nearly impossible to deal with Net Gears support or warranty network, worse experience I have ever had dealing with a customer support unit. I would have given it one star but it did work for 8 months.
customer_reviews.author: Easy Gunny

customer_reviews.title: Excellent router
customer_reviews.text: I read all the negative reviews here but I decided to get this router anyway as I have had good luck with netgear in the past. It was very easy to set up. I was able to plug in my external hard drive and my printer and access them from any of my computers. I'm very satisfied and I have not had any trouble with the router. Also, my TV and laptop in my basement now have full bars. They only had one or two with my old router. I think the problems others have had with this router were random problems any product will have from time to time.
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: It just rocks.
customer_reviews.text: One of those appliances that you need and don't want to ever worry about. This is it. It rocks, easy setup, great functionality, I simply love it. If my cable ever drops, and we all know it does, this will re-establish my connection without my intervention or me ever knowing it. I've had other routers that choked every time it got a little noise in the line and would need to be rebooted to grab a clean connection.., not this device. If it can connect, it will.
customer_reviews.author: PjcostaBgrt

customer_reviews.title: Love this router!
customer_reviews.text: I first purchased an Asus RT-AC66U Dual-Band Wireless-AC1750 for which I found the setup to be cumbersome. I enjoy being able to interface directly with the router without using setup software. The WNDR-4500 provides me with all the utility I require without the extra expense of the Asus. It may well be that someone else would prefer that option, as I think it's really just personal preference, however I'm enjoying the Netgear. It does exactly what I want.
customer_reviews.author: Ellis Guy

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: Took it out of the box, plugged it in and it worked. Almost perfectly. It does occasionally disconnect for a few seconds but not for very long and it has not been a problem so far. I originally bought the next model down and was very unhappy with it. it constantly disconnected and was slow. This one is great. Transferring files from one computer to another is fast and the internet connection (I use satellite) is just fine. Also very simple for guests to use.
customer_reviews.author: R. E. Barry

customer_reviews.title: Worked For A Short Time
customer_reviews.text: The router worked great for about two weeks. Then I started having problems, it would stop transmitting data to the cable modem. If I jacked directly into the cable modem I was fine, had no problems, but connecting through the router didn't work. I'd have to reset the router pretty often and that's annoying - what's the point? I put my old WRT-54G back in place and everything is happy again now. It doesn't have the N band and doesn't have the range, but it stays up. I'll take the reliability.
customer_reviews.author: Dee A

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: When trying to setup the Router, I could not detect any signal (2.4Ghz or 5 Ghz). The documentation that came with the router was a little thin. So I downloaded the manual from the Netgear internet site. The problem seemed to be with the firmware. When I contacted the Netgear Technical Support the problem was if fact corrupt firmware. The Netgear Techican guided me throught downloading and installing new firmware. The router now works correctly on both 2.4Ghz and 5 Ghz.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: NETGEAR Wireless Router - N900 Dual Band Gigabit (WNDR4500)
customer_reviews.text: I had a smaller wireless router, but my household of wireless items outgrew it. I purchased the WNDR4500 and it is able to handle the load. We sometimes have as high as 10 items connected to the router at one time and seldom have an overload problem now. I like the security it offers and with the Netgear Genie I can check to see that we are the only ones using it. It pretty much installed itself and walked me through everything. I am not disappointed in this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: East to Install and is Powerful & Flexible
customer_reviews.text: The router has a very strong signal throughout my old victorian home 2.5 story home. As a matter of fact, I can login to my wifi up to three homes away. But the most fabulous part of the router is installing the iPhone and iPad application called "Netgear Genie" that allows you to control access to the router; including temporary "guest access", reviewing traffic, setting adult parameters, and monitoring devices. I have gone through at least 4 routers in the past and this is, bar far, the best bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.author: Mark S. Criss

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I've only owned this for a few days but it's totally blown my mind. It's unbelievably fast. I use it to stream HD media, surf the net, connect to the tv/tivo/ps3, and as a VPN passthrough for my work computer. It never disconnects, and the media streaming never stutters or anything like that. Additionally, the build quality is good and the software it comes with is pretty good and easy to understand. The only negative is that I wish I bought it earlier as my old Linksys WRT160N router was seriously terrible.
customer_reviews.author: MilkoChicago

customer_reviews.title: Nice router, some reliability issues
customer_reviews.text: Pros: The range on this router is fantastic. Much better than the Linksys I switched from. The wired ports are gigabit and blazing fast. Setup is really easy. Cons: I have had to reflash the firmware 3 times due to power failures. I get the dreaded blinking green light. This is not a simple process. I know others who have this router and don't have this problem, so it could just be an issue for mine. It has a large footprint.
customer_reviews.author: David B.

customer_reviews.title: Good router but not the best value
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the best router that I came across over the past few years. It looks good. It is easy to install (no CD is provided or needed). Good 2.4G and 5G ranges. Usable Genie application that comes handy albeit not terribly informative. The router also comes with two USB which I had no chance to use.The main draw back is price. I believe the WNDR3400 N600 is more cost effective as it supports almost the same features at much reduced price tag.
customer_reviews.author: Pharaoh

customer_reviews.title: Top notch
customer_reviews.text: This thing really is tops. I was looking for speed and signal strength as well as VOIP compatibility and would give it 5 stars without hesitation. It has clocked wireless DS of 31.6 Mbps and US of 3.48 Mbps. I worked up to this model after trying an Amped Wireless sr10000 (poor quality),the Motorola SBG6580 (firmware v3.1 prevents VOIP), and Netgear N750 (great router, works well). Yes, the N900 is more expensive but it blows the others away. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Dieter R.

customer_reviews.title: Streaming video is so much easier
customer_reviews.text: It was a cinch to set up, compared to our old one. Signal coverage is at least twice as strong and the video streaming works every time! Windows 7 networking and wireless HP Printer now work consistently too. Replaced a 22-month-old cisco Linksys e1000 that choked at least once a month - we just had to reboot it constantly. We thought it was our ISP so we changed to a new one and the problem stayed the same until we got the Netgear.
customer_reviews.author: B@PA

customer_reviews.title: netgear
customer_reviews.text: This is a great router. Easy to set up, covers the whole house, does not take up much room, solid base and even looks good. It is worth every bit of the $150 I paid for it. I am not an expert on routers but tried 3 or 4 lesser routers before I tried this one and this was the only one which did everything I needed it too. I just had Amazon send this with their free shipping and received the product in 2 days.
customer_reviews.author: rock 1

customer_reviews.title: Good range and lots of features
customer_reviews.text: It gives you alot of flexibilty in how you setup your wireless and wired networks, I especially like the guest network and being able to isolate their activity on the fly using a browser. If you're familiar with Netgear, then you already know how their products work but this wndr4500 has alot of possibilities. Probably the best part is the signal strength. Even though I keep the 2.4Ghz bandwidth narrow (in consideration of my neighbors) at 217Mbps, I still get 5x5x5 streaming video to an iPad through 4 walls and 100ft. It's a keeper.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Easiest router I have ever had
customer_reviews.text: I love this router it is the easiest I have ever setup. I set it up with Windows, Linux and Mac all in less than one hour. Being able to hook a external drive up to it is great also. I can sync files without a web site now. I haven't tried the wireless printer option because my printer is already wireless but I assume that it is easy also. I definitely would recommend this to anyone looking for a new router.
customer_reviews.author: RustyJD

customer_reviews.title: After 1 year....  doing great!!
customer_reviews.text: I replaced the Netgear router I had been using... was doing a good job, but thought this newer, faster and "stronger" router would give me "better" coverage in my 2 story home.... After updates and twinking , it is doing great. Very good range in my 2 story home. Have had this router for about 1 year so far and it is doing great!!! I am sure the "newer" routers are better, but for now I am happy with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Farmerdan

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: First of all I'm not a techie or IT guy. I needed a new router for my insurance office and decided to buy the WNDR4500 based on several positive reviews I read elsewhere. I found this router very easy to hook up, the directions were straightforward, and my speeds for both wireless and wired connections have been consistent and more than adequate for my needs. I've had the router for six months now and have not experienced any technical problems.
customer_reviews.author: Windy City Guy

customer_reviews.title: Fast, Reliable, User-friendly
customer_reviews.text: This is the best router I've ever owned! It handles a lot of traffic from multiple devices reliably and with ease. Amazon service was excellent, as usual, and the packaging was a retail box in great shape. The only reason I gave it 4 stars is because the external storage you can access through the USB ports on the router, supposedly "from anywhere" via the internet, requires that a NETGEAR client program be installed on the machine you are trying to access it from, if you want use the files. Otherwise, all you can do is see what files are being stored...
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Most

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Since I got this router, my wife can watch Netflix on the 5GHz band WiFi BluRay Player/TV in the bedroom while my son plays a game on his laptop on the 2.4GHz band WiFi and I'm downloading files on the wired network. It's all fast, with no "hiccups" or "lags" in the streaming of movies or playing games. I also like the dual USB ports that allows me to have multiple hard drives of data available to multiple computers.
customer_reviews.author: galaraf

customer_reviews.title: Works great across multiple rooms
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace another router/modem combination that had just horrible WiFi Signals. Once I plugged this in.... I was able to stream HD movies via wireless in all the rooms of our house and to all devices. The setup was straight forward and I could see it be easy for someone with no experience in IT to use/setup as well. If you're a Gamer or heavy movie streamer... this should work just fine for you.
customer_reviews.author: KW

customer_reviews.title: Netgear router
customer_reviews.text: if everything would be so simple to setup, life with a computer would be much easier. The unit worked without a problem from the start. The setup was as easy as 1-2-3. I have to say, that I searched the Internet for recommendations and on all sites it came up as number one or two, so the experts were right. It is one of the best computer accessories I ever bought.
customer_reviews.author: olmy

customer_reviews.title: flawless
customer_reviews.text: this router has worked flawlessly since we bought it. we bought it to replace our constantly freezing/rebooting dlink gaming router. the usb ports worked great with a usb hard disk and a memory stick. everyone is easily able to connect to it when they visit and we get strong signals for all the types. easily covers my 2300 sq ft house, and it's off to one side, not in the middle.
customer_reviews.author: ANDREW

customer_reviews.title: Speed made simple
customer_reviews.text: This router took less than 20 minutes to install. It gave me a 300 to 500% increase in the speed of my wireless and doubled the transfer rate of my wired connections. The secure setup was painless and straight forward. I have not tried the shared USB drive function but have both my printers on the shared USB and it works fine. My cell phones (one Iphone and one Android) would not connect to my old router and some visitors had issues with their notebooks also. This router has accepted everything I have thrown at it. I highly recommend this router.
customer_reviews.author: G. Aumaugher

customer_reviews.title: great router!
customer_reviews.text: I switched from a Linksys router to this one and what a difference! I was constantly getting drop outs, having to reset the router, getting poor coverage in the house with my old router and all those problems went away with this new NetGear router. Don't believe the ratings that list Linksys above these guys, instead go check out the user reviews and see who is really the most satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: ValuBuilder

customer_reviews.title: Stop working after only 10 months
customer_reviews.text: If you thought buying an expensive router would mean it would last longer, you're in for a surprise. After having this "wonderful" router work for the last 10 months. It has decided to go off the deep end and not be useable. As I should of known a product with a warranty of 90 days is bound to go bad. Never will buy from this company again.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: best router ever...
customer_reviews.text: If you want the best this is it. Fastest. best for distance. eazyiest hook up & setup ever.no disc needed. 4 Ethernet ports. 2 USB ports. Free download of genie software. Stylish looking. Great mapping of your network tons of possibllites. Wireless hard drives & wireless printer. I have had no problems with this @ all. Most reliable router I've ever owned
customer_reviews.author: TAZ-MAN-TIM

customer_reviews.title: Worked like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Easy to order, quick on delivery, and fixed the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Asche

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Wireless Router
customer_reviews.text: Mine works great. It has more reach than the NetGear WNDR3700 it replaced, and the control interface is more manageable. The only downside to this router is the clear, plastic mounting platform that cannot be removed - I prefer to lay my router down without the stand, but that is purely an aesthetic thing. The positioning of the router could very well be the reason that this one has more reach than the previous version.
customer_reviews.author: JRG

customer_reviews.title: Best Router I ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: I've had very expensive routers, and this one beats them all. Easy to set up, and I always get a good signal to all rooms in house. I have yet to have it go offline on me like others I've purchased. If you want trouble free service from your router then chose this one. You won't regret it! At least I haven't obviously. I have no complaints at all with it.
customer_reviews.author: Lee P.

customer_reviews.title: Great router with neat features
customer_reviews.text: We got this router to replace a MediaLink router we had just purchased that kept dropping out when we tried to watch Netflix or any other streamed video. This router works great and has some neat features. One is a print feature that allowed us to make our wireless printer visible to our iPads and iPhones so we could print directly to it without having to use a special app. We have had only moderate luck with the printer apps, so this was a nice bonus.
customer_reviews.author: FL Gator

customer_reviews.title: My husband loves this router
customer_reviews.text: I don't know a whole lot about electronics, but my husband does and he chose this router and asked me to write a good review because he likes it so much. According to him, it was very easy to set up and link with our 3 laptops, 2 iPhones, Roku, tablet, and wireless printer. I really like that it has a USB for an external hard drive, so I can save documents and access them from any of our laptops. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: KU Grad 02

customer_reviews.title: Netgear says no warranty!
customer_reviews.text: I just bought it, after submitting my registration Netgear informed me that if purchased from Amazon I would not get warranty??? Says Amazon is not an authorized re-seller. The router itself is nice, I like it. Easy to hook up, fast, nice. But why bother if it voids your warranty??
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I had no idea what I was missing for wireless performance with my old Linksys WRT-54G. This N900 rocks. My internet speed on wireless is the same as wired now. 4MB up/25MB down on wireless using speedtest.net is not bad at all (with Comcast). All the features are really nice. I have also used the guest wireless feature recently. My Linksys was disconnecting wireless clients at random times. Not this unit; no disconnects at all.
customer_reviews.author: d_mo

customer_reviews.title: No Tech support from NETGEAR
customer_reviews.text: I never could log in to the router and when I called for support they wanted money since Sheep Media is NOT an authorized dealer.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin C.

customer_reviews.title: Best so far. I have had several.
customer_reviews.text: This is the one I recommend to everyone. Until I find something better. Which hasn't happen. I have this one and have told several clients to buy it. The dual band is perfect. I have everyone on the standard network setup as they need to be and as guest or visitors come by I give them guest access. They can do what they need without concern that they will see my network. I have it configured for remote access. No issues there. I seldom have to reset it, even when the modem goes down.
customer_reviews.author: D. Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Expensive, but if you want a wireles router for Charter Cable this is the one to get.
customer_reviews.text: Charter Cable only recommends a couple of wireless routers. This item is expensive, but after reading reviews I have purchased two of these routers, one for my daughter, and another for a friend. They both were easy to setup, and the wireless works for a good distance, even outside.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory M. Spitzer

customer_reviews.title: The product was DOA (dead on arrival)
customer_reviews.text: I liked Netgear products in the past. In fact this new WNDR4500 was bought as a replacement for WNDR3700, which was a good product 3 years ago and still works now. However, when I've unpacked and installed the router, it wasn't working and flashed green power LED, which the manual lists as "firmware corruption" issue. This could be software or hardware related issue, in either case it represents weak quality control at Netgear.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard

customer_reviews.title: Rocking
customer_reviews.text: My ASUS DIED after a little more then a year, well actually it DIDNT die completely it just became completely unreliable. So went and checked for the reviews and gave this a try. COULD NOT BE HAPPIER! Im now a convert Netgear has been amazing since day 1 and this is my frist netgear rauter but i can tell you this it will be my first brand when upgrading in a year or so.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo Orrantia Ponce

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: This unit has brought me out of the info dark ages-- the signal will extent nearly a block so coverage within the house is now great--2 frequencies to choose from and lots of wireless options--and excellent support when I needed it to set up my TV and wonderful followup to be sure was happy with the unit--A very good price on an expensive item -- worth every penny of it !!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: G Shorb

customer_reviews.title: If you want a reliable internet conneciton Don't Purchase this Router
customer_reviews.text: So I am on my second router at this point and I only purchased this on 4/10. The wired and wireless internet connections are not reliable and constantly drop out. Netgear has sent me a replacement router and that does not resolve the issue. I have spent several hours on the phone with Netgear technical support and they are unable to resolve the issue. They tell me after changing a setting ok monitor the connection and then call us back. Bottom line if you are looking for a reliable connection than do not purchase this router. I am beginning the process of researching a new router at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Will-P

customer_reviews.title: Worked well, but Lasted about a year before it ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked well, but Lasted about a year before it started to die. I would have to powered off and on many times for it to boot, after about another month is stopped working entirely.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It even looks pretty
customer_reviews.text: I lived with a Linksys router for 5 years, and had become accustomed to randomly having to reboot it every month or so. Haven't rebooted in about 3 months of owning this, running both networks and the wired network. Used WPS for a printer, worked great. Intuitive interface (which I haven't had to touch since day 1, because everything is working).
customer_reviews.author: DoctorOfRock

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE  readyhare printer doesn't work for mac os x and above BROKE MY COMPUTER
customer_reviews.text: router is ok but printer sharing doesn't work for mac OS X 10.9 or above printer utility froze my mac and had a kernel panic and i had to do a system restore was a pain but thankfully i had a backup
customer_reviews.author: Akram I.

customer_reviews.title: Netgear N900
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased and installed the N9000/WNDR4500. It is by far the easiest setup I've ever experienced with any computer and network equipment. No CD just a six step installation proccess and it is done! The speed of the router is amazing, downstream HD videos are a pleasure to watch, no disconnects what so ever.I highly recommend the N900.
customer_reviews.author: hound

customer_reviews.title: Easily flashable router.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to flash Tomato on, and it works perfectly. Fast speeds, able to act as a wireless client on one band and a wireless AP on the other.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Y.

customer_reviews.title: Quick setup, no problems
customer_reviews.text: I haven't bought a router in a while and found this one the easiest to set up. I was up and going in just a couple of minutes. I've been using it now for a couple of months and basically I set it up and forgot about it because I have had no problems at all. Never needed to reset it. We connected 2 iphones, 2 ipads and 4 laptops of different brands flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: CWR

product_meta.title: Netgear WiFi Dual Band Gigabit Router (WNDR4500-100NAS)
product_meta.description:
The NETGEAR N900 Wireless Dual Band Gigabit Router delivers the ultimate performance and range, with a fast, reliable and secure wireless connection to the Internet. Create a powerful home network for applications such as streaming 3DHD video and multiplayer gaming. New N900 wireless provides up to 450 + 450 Mbps speed and with simultaneous dual band technology avoids interference ensuring top WiFi speeds. Two USB ports enable connections to external hard drives and printers.IPv6 support (Internet Protocol Version 6).

AMAZON.COM
feature_bullets: Wireless N900 Wireless Dual Band Gigabit Router with WiFi Speeds up to 900 Mbps (450 + 450) ideal for HD video streaming and other demaning applications
Security - Best in class (WPA/WPA2?PSK) and WEP and Push ?N? Connect ensures a quick and secure network connection using WiFi Protected Setup? (WPS)

NETGEAR Genie - Easy dashboard control to manage, monitor and repair your home network.Microsoft Internet Explorer 5.0, Firefox 2.0, Safari 1.4, or Google Chrome 11.0 browsers or higher.Microsoft Windows 8, Windows 7, Vista, XP, 2000, Mac OS, UNIX or Linux
WiFi Range - Simulateous Dual Band doubles bandwidth while reducing WiFi interefearece and is ideal for larger homes with many connected devices

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars1,257 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
